SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FOUNDATION ALSO SERVES AS THE CUSTODIAN AND DEPOSITORY OF THE OTHER TYPES OF COLLECTION ITEMS,SUCH AS DOCUMENTS BOOKS,ARTIFACTS FILMS PHOTOS AWARDS AND FURNITURE DEVELOPED AND GENERATED DURING THE ADMINISTRATION OF MRS. CALDERON AS GOVERNOR OF PUERTO RICO PURSUANT TO AC 290 OF SEPTEMBER 1 2000. OTHER ITEMS 1997-2000. CERTAIN OTHER WORKS OF ART DOCUMENTS BOOKS PHOTOS AND FURNITURE BELONGING TO MRS. CALDERON HAVE ALSO BEEN MADE AVAILABLE BY HER FOR PUBLIC EXHIBITION AND RESEARCH AT THE CENTER. THESE COLLECTIONS ARE THE PROPERTY OF THE GENERAL ARCHIVES OF THE COMMONWEALTH OF PUERTO RICO AND OF MRS. CALDERON AND AS SUCH,ARE NOT INCLUDED IN THE ACCOMPANYING FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.

| Description:, Expense Amount:, Grants Amount:, Revenue Amount:| FORM 990- ORGANIZATION'S MISSION - THE MISSION OF THE SILA M.CALDERON FOUNDATION IS TO UNDERTAKE ACTIONS SERVICES,PROGRAMS AND PROJECTS PRIMARILY ON THE ISSUES OF POVERTY AND THE ROLE OF WOMAN IN SOCIETY; AND SECONDARILY ON URBAN REVITALIZATION AND ETHICAL VALUES AND SOCIAL RESPONSABILITY. TO ARCHIVE THIS MISSION,THE FOLLOWING OBJECTIVES HAVE BEEN ESTABLISHED: i REDUCE POVERTY AND INEQUITY: ii. ADVANCE THE ROLE OF WOMEN IN SOCIETY: iii. PROMOTE URBAN REVITALIZATION AND BALANCE; AND iv. STRENGTHEN ETHICAL VALUES AND SOCIAL RESPONSABILITY., $0, $0, $0| FORM 990 PART Ill LINE 4a- FIRST ACCOMPLISHMENT THE SILA M. CALDERON FOUNDATION WAS ESTABLISHED AS A NON-FOR-PROFIT ABO NONPARTISAN ORGANIZATION TO REDUCE POVERTY AND INEQUITY,ADVANCE WOMEN IN SOCIETY PROMOTE URBAN REVITALIZATION AND BALANCE AND STRENGTHEN ETHICAL VALUES AND SOCIAL RESPONSIBILITY THROUGH A CENTER FOR EDUCATION DIALOGUE RESEACH,AND ADVOCACY EFFORTS OF PUERTO RICANS ON THE ISLAND AND ON THE MAINLAND. THE FOUNDATION'S FACILITIES HOUSE A SPECIALIZED LIBRARY TECHNOLOGY CENTER AND ARCHIVE THAT SUPPORT AND ENABLE RESEACH IN ITS FOUR MISSION AREAS. ALTHOUGH THE LIBRARY IS RESEARCH ORIENTED,IT IS ALSO OPEN TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC AND ROUTINELY USED BY RESIDENTS OF THE COMMUNITY.AN AVERAGE OF 400 PEOPLE VISIT THE LIBRARY ON A MONTHLY BASIS AND AN ADDITIONAL NUMBER OF VISITORS ARRIVE FOR SPECIAL EVENTS SUCH AS BOOK PRESENTATIONS AND LECTURES WHICH ARE FREE TO ATTED.THE OFFICIAL ARCHIVES OF THE FORMER GOVERNOR'S YEARS OF PUBLIC SERVICE ARE ALSO STORED AT THE CENTE. THESE DOCUMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE TO RESEARCHERS AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC IN PAPER FORM OR IN DIGITAL COPIES.AN AVERAGE OF 4 RESEARCH CONSULTATIONS ARE ATTENDED PER WEEK., $0, $0, $0| THROUGH THE CENTER FOR PUERTO RICO,THE FOUNDATION SUPPORT AND PLACES EMPHASIS ON ACTIVITIES AND PROJECTS THAT EDUCATE,CAPACITATE,AND EMPOWER COMMUNITY LEADERS AND OTHER NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS WORKING AT THE GRASS ROOT LEVEL. THROUGH ITS DIFFERENT PROJECTS AND ACTIVITIES THE CENTER SEEKS OPPORTUNITIES AND INCENTIVES FOR INDIVIDUAL ACTION SUSTAINABLE CHANGE AND HUMAN DEVELOPMENT. TO THIS EFFECT THE CENTER HAS CARRIED OUT A CAPACITY BUILDING PROGRAM FOR ENTREPRENURIAL COMMUNITY INITIATIVES WHICH HAS IMPACTED MORE THAN 3000 COMMUNITY LEADERS AND RESIDENTS OF LOW INCOME NEIGHBORHOODS IN ALLIANCE WITH THE UNIVERSITY OF PUERTO RICO OTHER COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT ORGANIZATIONS,AND PARTNER FROM THE ENTREPRENEURIAL ECOSYSTEM. THE PROGRAMS HAVE RESULTED IN THE DESIGM OF 700 ENTREPRENEURIAL COMMUNITY INITIATIVES ACCRISS THE ISLAND MOST OF WHICH MOVED TO IMPLEMENTATION AFTER THE PROGRAM ENDED.DURING 2021 THE CENTER HAS FOCUSED ITS SUPPORT TO THESE INITIATIVES IN PROVIDING ADDITIONAL EDUCATION TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND NETWORKING OPPORTUNITIES. THE CENTER CONTINUES TO WORK HAND IN HAND WITH COMMUNITY LEADERS AND ENTREPRENEURS TO REACH OPERATIONAL SUSTAINNABILITY., $0, $0, $0| FORM 990 PART Ill LINE 4d -ALL OTHER ACCOMPLISHMENTS COMMUNITY AND MICROENTREPRENEURAL POST PROGRAM INCENTIVES GIVEN TO PARTICIPANTS FORM 990 PART VI LINE 2- RELATED PARTY INFORMATION AMONG OFFICERS MARIA ELENA GONZALEZ CALDERON -TRUSTEE DAUGHTER SILA M. CALDERON - PRESIDENT BOD MOTHER FORM 990 PART VI LINE 11b - ORGANIZATION'S PROCESS TO REVIEW FORM 990 THE TAX RETURN IS REVIEW BY THE FINANCE AND ADMINISTRATION DIRECTOR AND BY THE FINANCE COMMITTEE,AS DESIGNATED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTOS.
